body.p:
Blandville Ky. Decr. 1st 1863
Govr. Bramlitte
Sir

I have been requested by the parties interested to state you the facts of a case, in which I understand application will be made to you for remission of a fine. At the last Septr. Term of the Ballard Circuit Court a fine of Two Hundred Dollars was imposed on Jos. McCanlly & W. Garrett for suffering gaming in their house in Blandsville. It was proven on the trial that parties had played cards in their house at which treats of liquor, cigars, oysters &c were played for and paid for by the losers and that the proprietors sd the McCanlley & Garrett knew that said treats were played for. It was proven that the sd. Garrett & McCanlley allways forbid the playing for money and would not allow it in their house. I believe that the defendants did not believe that they were violating the law, and They are poor men with families. I believe they violated the law ignorantly.

Ballard County
Prayer for Remission
Ref
Refused
Tho E Bramlette
1863
